website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to comfort, KEEN Gypsum II Mid Waterproof delivered well. Its minimal break-in period, the ankle support, and roomy toe box were some of the reasons why consumers felt satisfied with this pair. The insulation and well-performing outsole were also acknowledged by wearers.On the flip side, users experienced issues in the sole and metal hooks. Everything considered, it's a comfortable boot for hiking, yet consumers have to be cautious of its signs of wear and tear and be prepared to use its product warranty.
pros: It required little-to-no breaking in, as testified by many wearers
The majority loved how comfortable the KEEN Gypsum II Mid Waterproof was
They said that they did not want to take it off
The ankle support of this day hiking boot was applauded by a handful
Numerous consumers liked how it provided them warmth on cold conditions
One even sent a pair to her son in Alaska
She said that it served her son well
KEEN’s Gypsum II Mid Waterproof was indeed a lightweight hiking boot, as claimed by a lot of users
Some were amazed with the fit of these boots
The outsole of the Gypsum II Mid Waterproof received approvals from a considerable number of wearers
They attested that it did not retain mud or snow during their hikes
Several users appreciated the roomy toe box
They mentioned that they have enough space to wiggle their toes
cons: A couple of Gypsum II Mid Waterproof purchasers were disappointed with its durability
One noted that the soles separated after two months of use
A handful of wearers found the pair to be too warm for the summer season
The metal hooks on the top of the boots broke off
This was experienced by a significant number of users
Some disliked the insufficient arch support from KEEN’s Gypsum II Mid Waterproof
They had to replace the insoles to get better support on their arches

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable boot but they didn't last at all.
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit and felt great for the short time they stayed intact but their durability was terrible. They didn't even make it 100 miles before the tread delaminated. One chunk on my toe was lost entirely and other parts cracked and began to peel away. Totally unacceptable and it was too late to return to Amazon. I moved up to the Durand series which is about $30 more expensive and has a solid sole/tread. They're more durable but not as comfortable. I think next set I'll try Merril or another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Case

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfortable right out of the box without ...
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and comfortable right out of the box without the normal stiffness and required break-in period. Hikes in the snow have kept my feet warm and dry. FYI-these are made in Chine. I thought all Keens were made in the USA but these are not. Four stars due to the top string eyelets which are plastic and seem like a weak point. I would have paid the extra nickel or dime for metal ones, which I expected at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Finally found a boot for my big fat feet.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are an old man's dream. My feet are shot. Working as a chef and years of running in combat boots have taken a toll on my dogs. In preparation for my second Philmont trek, I looked past my old Vasque GTXs. I went a size larger in the Keen. That, coupled with the roomy toebox were the perfect combo. On a recent practice hike, with 45 pounds, the boots performed flawlessly on some pretty rugged terrain. The gummy soles were great on boulders and steep granite. I'll update if necessary, but for now, they are five stars all day.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Ordering Another Pair of Good Boots
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots so much that I just ordered again. Only reason I don't give it a 5 star is the vibram soles are slippery on wet rocks and the Keen insole is useless. I immediately remove the Keen insole and get a pair of Sofcomfort heavy-duty boot insoles. Boots have a nice, wide toe box, good lacing, reasonably water proof as I have submerged the boots close to the top in mud, and stitching has not come loose. I have two pair. One for hiking and the second I wear at work five days a week where they get a real workout and still comfortable at the end of the day. I really like these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good Waterproof Work Boot
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying these boots. I use them for work and the last couple of days have found me in them for 16+ hours. The tread is aggressive enough for my hiking duties yet pliable for all day use and comfort. The padding around the ankles is stiff and will require breaking in. I like the leather for durability and the fabric for ventilation. All in all I would recommend buying this waterproof boot.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Narrow
customer_reviews.text: More like 3.25 These run narrow in the toe box. Not the best Keens I’ve owned. Light. Hurt my toes, bottoms of my feet, and Achilles tendon after only two miles on moderate to easy trails in NY forrest - without a pack. Update: nasty blisters on ankle on right foot after 3 mile, no pack hike up steep mountain and down. wet trail. Tight toe box is no fun going down. Feet stayed dry even after plunging in bog. Not even remotely the best Keens. Not the worst, either. They’re well-made, but the fit is wonky.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Two right boots, check your order carefully.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these boots and I ordered them when I began to see the first pair beginning to fail. When they arrived I inspected them and put on one boot to check the fit which was perfect. Then they went into the closet for two months until yesterday. Much to my surprise I found that I had received two right boots instead of a right and left. It is my own fault for not checking but I knew they were good boots so I didn't bother and the return window ended last month. The boots themselves are great, the two stars are for sending me two right shoes not the boot.
customer_reviews.author: thegeelans

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for hiking or every day wear!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best boots I have ever worn! They are comfortable and waterproof as described. After nearly a year of wear they still look new! It took a couple weeks to break them in but now they are perfect. I have had several pair of keens and recommend this style and brand. They have many miles on them and will continue for many many more.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: fit great and are very confortable with an agressive tread!
customer_reviews.text: they fit well and havea wider footbed than I expected. wore them around the house for one day, cut the grass in them the next day. a few days later I wore them camping for 4 days straight. I feet weren't sore in weird places. they were tired but they would be in any shoe after hiking many miles a day. they shoe no wear or tear so far and still look new, I haven't had the pleasure of trekking through any mud or water to if they really shine, but in the hot july sun my feet didn't cry. get em, im loving them so far.
customer_reviews.author: paul biltz

customer_reviews.title: These boots are fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several different models of Keen hiking boots, some better than others. These boots are very comfortable once you wear them a few times. Like any other shoe, it takes a little wearing before they really conform to your feet. They're light yet durable. I highly recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: W. Raisch

customer_reviews.title: Definitely will purchase these again!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a ups driver and have been for 26 years and I’m in and out of the truck over a hundred times a day. My feet have always been cold and wet by the end of the day before I got these. These are light weight and breathable along with being water proof. Easily the best boot for work I’ve ever owned and I go through at least one or two pair a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight , great fit and great stability in cold , icy and snowy weather.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight . Great traction and comfortable foot bed. Trails have been, hard pack snow , icy uneven gravel roads , temps between 7 and 30 degrees . My 4 instead of 5 star is it’s light weight construction in my mind may lessen the longevity of the boot. I have keen boots 5 plus years old and I still love them . I hope these boots prove me wrong. Note: I only wear keen boots. Period.
customer_reviews.author: keith rabin

customer_reviews.title: Painfully firm heel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this boot through amazon because the first pair I purchased 2 years ago fit perfect. This pair feels like the area around the heel sticks out too far. I was hoping this would be resolved by “breaking them in” but no luck yet.. It is quite painful and doesn’t seem to be getting any better. Is it possible that I have received a defective pair? I didn’t experience anything like this with the first pair. Any information regarding this would be greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Hoke Little

customer_reviews.title: Issues
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the first pair because someting in the right shoe sticks down into the toes. The return went fine but when i received another pair they have the same issue, just not as bad. So i guess ill keep them because i need them but definitely not satisfied with spending this kind of money for whats supposed to be a top brand to get such cheaply made product with issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable boots!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these boots(my first pair have lasted me three years so far and still going, they are too scuffed up for work) I love these boots, they are super comfortable and work great for my outdoorsy life style. I originally bought them for hiking (which they do very well, good grip, support, and comfort) and ended up wearing them every day for work. I spend a lot of my time standing/walking on concrete everyday and these boots are very good for that. I haven't had any issues with the sole separating from the shoe either.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent work/hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes, they fit well, they are heavy duty, stay dry as they are waterproof ( personally i am not on board with the chemicals involved in this but he loves this aspect) and are light weight. His last pair lasted well over a year being tortured. We live on a farm and his work day is not spent in a carpeted office. Firewood, fixing cars on concrete, hiking, grading the roads, these are his go to work boots
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Gunderson

customer_reviews.title: Great boots. Took them hiking through Zion National Park ...
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. Took them hiking through Zion National Park and they held up like champs. I walked 30 miles in them the first two days and my feet couldn't have felt better. You can walk through puddles and small streams without getting wet. The ankle support helped prevent me turning my ankle on rocks. They breathe well, keeping my feet cool even in 100 degree plus days. Very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Alison and or Grant Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutly Love Them!
customer_reviews.text: Usually I had been buying Txxxxxland because of the out of box comfort. Then last year I got my 1st pair of Keen. A little stiff but boy did the soles wear well and the outsides looked great a year later. Well I thought I'd try another pair. Boy was I surprised. At first I thought the box was empty. The boot is very light, extremely well made and true to size. Broken in out of the box. Please try this mid hiker, you won't he disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: By far the best pair of hiking boots I've owned. They felt custom fit for my feet and there was literally no break in period. I've used them in snow and himed through small streams and my felt stayed dry through it all. I've even had multiple compliments on their stylish looks and even recommended them to other people. Very very happy thus far. This is my second pair of Keens (first were water shoes which too are awesome. Merrel who?
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but...
customer_reviews.text: I love Keen footwear. I use them in place of tactical boots as a law enforcement officer. These showed up, fit perfectly, crazy comfortable, all the support I live them for with just one problem.. Unlike in the picture, these ones came as an almost uncomfortable green color. Very strange. Not sure if it was just that pair, but had to go with something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are nice and might fit some people well, but the rubber protector over the toe seemed restrictive to the movement of my foot and toes. I returned them for a refund for this reason. I am normally a 12 and these were snug for me. They are a great looking shoe but seem like they could be warm if walking a lot in the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua F. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Comfy right out of the box and no problems with water.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a girl with big feet and need a large toe box. This boot is perfect. I have hiked in mud for the past week and never even thought about leaking, sweating or rubbing. There was no breaking in period and the mud seems to fall off easy when stomped on the porch.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots for multi-day backpacking in colder climates. I wore them all day at work straight out of the box with no issues. I took them on a 10 mile snow hike three days after I received them and they did amazing! Comfortable and durable. As they are waterproof, that are a little hot. So I would suggest they are used in cooler environments. Also, because my feet swell a little on long distance hikes, I always order my boots one half size larger and that works out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Shuck

customer_reviews.title: rubber loosening from boot
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in July and used them for a 2 weeks at scouts summer camp. The glue is failing on the sides of both boots where the rubber meets the boot. i expected better quality from the Keen brand and had hoped to get years out of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: coffee and books

customer_reviews.title: spring / fall boot
customer_reviews.text: Great KEEN boot for mid weather , water proof, great fit around the instep. , I wear a 10 , these are 10 , I am getting the 10.5 to try , need a touch more toe room , right now hot amazon pricing , $30 cheaper that listed ..
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mc- Dad

customer_reviews.title: Get them!
customer_reviews.text: Another amazing Keen product. I wear these all day every day during warm months at work in the mountains. Absolutely supportive. Absolutely comfortable. Absolutely waterproof. Great ankle support and offer a stiff enough footbed to provide better protection and comfort on the rocky stuff.
customer_reviews.author: dtman88

customer_reviews.title: Product came scratched!
customer_reviews.text: Boots came scratched, like they were the ones on display, or used once. Not happy at all. And not being able to return the product frustrates me. For some reason I can’t contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These boots developed a very heavy chemical smell in just a few wearings.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Keen boots in the past and expected these boots to be of similar quality. Unfortunately these boots have the 'China Chemical Odor' problem. They must have used formaldihyde or some other banned chemical in the manufacture as these boots REEK of a very strong chemical odor. It is not foot odor as none of my other shoes have this problem nor do my feet smell bad. I'd not buy these again, and I'm hoping the Keen company will do something to remedy this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keen 11M.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got a chance to really put these shoes to the test. I hiked a bit in Smokey Mountain National Park. The shoes I ordered dont seem to fit. I have always bought this size Keen shoe or boot. Never a problem before. These boots see seem narrow. They were never comfy. I thought they needed broke in. They did not. I feel I got wrong size or possble factory seconds. These do not feel like Keens. I will probably stick with stores that have a less restrictive return policy for shoes and boots in the future.
customer_reviews.author: darrell pruitt

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I am a shoe collector and a hobbyist photographer, let me tell you these boots are the best hiking boots I have EVER owned, Now I just wear them everywhere! except work, which I am also buying a Keen!
customer_reviews.author: Lowapproach

customer_reviews.title: Great boot with excellent support.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot. This is my fourth pair of Keen boots but my first pair of Gypsum's. I generally get about a thousand miles before replacing them. The Gypsum has a slightly higher collar that provides a bit more ankle support. It's a little warm so I'd wear it any season but summer.
customer_reviews.author: Ron L.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly narrow...
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly, this pair of Keen hiking boots were too narrow, though I have used this same size before with Keen. I could soon tell this pair was going to cause my toes grief on any good hike.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Swearingen

customer_reviews.title: Hiking
customer_reviews.text: Keen are made here in the USA, for1, very lightweight, yet, quite durable!! My last pair of Keens, I must have put a thousand miles on them!
customer_reviews.author: John VanHuysen

customer_reviews.title: 6 month shoes
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Feb. sole separated in Aug. Some of the best wearing boots I've owned, however 6 months of use doesn't justify the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: Work pretty good
customer_reviews.text: My old man uses these boots for Masonry. They last about a year in that kind of work. its pretty brutal on clothes and boots
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: so great deal. What I liked about these is the ...
customer_reviews.text: Had Keens before and knew the size would fit. Saw these at a shoe store for much more, so great deal. What I liked about these is the leather lacing, where as the Targhee had fabric that eventually wore out and split on one loop. Hiked in them this past weekend, rocky terrain. Comfortable and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A.

customer_reviews.title: weak sole, falls apart
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit awesome, go on easy, and have good ankle support. Unfortunately, having them less than a year and not wearing them every day, the sole is falling apart. I was also walking through a mowed pasture and got a 5" twig through the sole in one of the soft spots and out the top, narrowly missing my foot. The problems are on opposite ends. I really like them, but they fall short on lasting and light protection. If they didn't have these issues, I would never buy a different boot.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Felt great from day one.
customer_reviews.text: It's always tough to replace an old loyal pair of boots. However, I am very pleased with these boots thus far and from day one they felt as if I had been wearing them for years. Have not really put them through the paces nor exposed to conditions requiring the waterproofing but I have no reason to believe they won't perform as expected. I considered many other brands and styles but so many others looked like winter boots vs a year-round boot that could be worn just about anywhere with a pair of jeans without looking ridiculous. Price was awesome at the time - paid about 30% less than I would have at local REI.
customer_reviews.author: J. Darley

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots so far
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots so far, a little stiff but I think they will break in over time. Wore them a day at the office then jump into a 10-mile hike the next day. The first mile was a little painful but after readjusting the laces the rest of the trip was fine. Even got to test out the waterproofing and it worked great!! I love Keen this is my 3rd pair I have no arch and love how they fit.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Faggion

customer_reviews.title: Broken Eyelet
customer_reviews.text: I love Keens! And have owned 10+ pairs of boots and Sandals, but the eyelet has failed after about 12 hours of use.... I will be returning but giving this same model a second chance.
customer_reviews.author: justin evans

customer_reviews.title: Texas Hill Country and Fat Feet
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking boot I've ever owned so far. Only been using for about three months in rocky, Texas Hill Country terrain but am seriously considering buying another pair right now as backups for when these fail. Waterproofing has been effective. They fit great on my super wide fat foot. I'm a 10.5 EE in cowboy boots and I ordered these in an 11 and they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sole falls apart
customer_reviews.text: I used these for a few day hikes last fall and rotated them this summer with some older Taghee II Keen boots. The sole began to come off! I have been glueing the soles back on to try and get a little more use from them. But they clearly have a problem with the sole. I cannot recommend buying these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie W

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made sole
customer_reviews.text: Sole does not hold up to even moderate trail use. Uppers hold up fairly well, though very permeable to moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Valdon Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with some Keens
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. Originally bought them for work. Now I’m using them at home and in town and at work... very comfortable. Had an issue with a sore spot on my right foot from the boot rubbing. But after a few days no more issues. The seams are holding up great and the eyelets are very sturdy. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ChriNoDa

customer_reviews.title: Control on single track variable trail
customer_reviews.text: Keen hiking shoes are unmatched. The bottom doesn't trap mud and bridges over rocks and roots without your foot feeling it equalling less fatigue. The right amount of leather coming off the sole gives proper support when moving downhill or at an angle on loose surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fit great!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are the most comfortable, best fitting hiking boots I have ever owned. They fit snugly without being too tight. I am looking forward to some serious hiking in these great fitting boots.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Hendershott

customer_reviews.title: Keen is a known commodity to us
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had some toe issues and requires a wide toe box. We know Keen well and have bought many of their products before. We were appreciative of finding a good price here.
customer_reviews.author: vknolan

customer_reviews.title: Nice house shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Tried to spend a little less than asolo money, you can feel every pebble thru the soul of this boot, and in fact Tried to kick something into place and ended up at the doctor! When I got home two week old keen s went out with the trash
customer_reviews.author: matt scott

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be up to par with most keens I've had. Leather seems a bit thicker/sturdier than some Keen's I've owned. I'm using them as a cool weather/ winter boot with wool socks for hiking. So far so good. Comfortable and fits like a standard Keen.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Always have good luck with Keen
customer_reviews.text: Always have good luck with Keen. Whether it's work boots, tennis shoes or these hiking boots. The work boots hold up to harsh conditions of railroad track maintenance. Like the removable footbed and the wide toe box on both steel toe and composite toe boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof but not breathable=swampy feet
customer_reviews.text: Meh. I want to like these boots because they fit my fat feet, but the waterproofing doesn't breathe and my feet feel swampy at the end of the day. I wish they had Gore-Tex water-proofing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Hold Up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 3 months ago and the tread is already falling apart. I'm very disappointed with this set of boots. I usually hike about 10 miles a day for work, but this year I've been mostly in the office writing reports. There's no reason my boots should look like this.
customer_reviews.author: rwasham

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, got them for the winter ( its ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, got them for the winter ( its July) so I dont know how they will hold up but very comfortable for me right out of the box.Took them on a little walk 9 miles through the hills at about 9700 feet in Colorado. In the rain over the weekend, I am happy !!
customer_reviews.author: Dean O

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot!
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality shoe which I expected, given Keen's reputation for quality and durability. The leather smells great right out of the box as well!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Keen Gypsum
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. I have ordered them over and over for years.
customer_reviews.author: JuneauReader

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: I work in construction and Keen is the most comfortable and durable boot I've ever worn. I have an insulated pair for outdoor winter work and this pair is for everything else. These breathe well in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Have had these for a few weeks. I wear them everyday, they broke in very quickly. Fit is perfect, waterproof, comfortable and well constructed! I will definalty keep buying these boots as I wear home out!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Solid boot hope that it holds up!
customer_reviews.text: This a very supportive boot. The toe area is a bit snug whereas the rest of the boot fits very well. I have not used the boot other that some mild walking so I do not know how it will hold up. I did stand in about four inches of water just to see if they are truly waterproof, my feet were dry as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Love them right out of the box. Been a loyal Keen and Timberland customer for years. Tried two different pair of Timberlands - didn't fit correctly. Ordered the Keens, Fit like a glove out of the box, comfy, no issues, no break in. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Beware of style change that causes blisters
customer_reviews.text: Bad bad bad. My fifth pair of these. They have changed the heel so it digs into the back of your foot and caused two huge blisters. Tried a second time; same result. Compared with old pair. There is a band around the back that rubs you the wrong way. Called Keen and they said sorry but no help. Checked a new pair ar REI and same change.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality boot, comfortable and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: Great work/hiking boot. Comfortable with good amount of room for toes and ball of foot. I would recommend this shoe/boot.
customer_reviews.author: Norann McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Next pair I am going to go up a half size and they should fit just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Keen boots and they all hold up really well. One thing I have noticed with the Gypsum II is it fits a little small. Next pair I am going to go up a half size and they should fit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Lynx

customer_reviews.title: At least a 1/2 size smaller than your dress shoe size.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe runs small. I bought 1/2 size larger than my dress shoe size. I wish I would have gotten a full size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, but China made.
customer_reviews.text: Fits well at 1/2 size more than my usual. Comfortable from the get-go. Wore them for field work and no complaints. Don't like at all that they are made in China!
customer_reviews.author: nick casto

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Boots
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. So far I’ve been using them for about 1 month during summer and they feel great. One of the most comfortable boots I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Coco B Ware

customer_reviews.title: Keen boots are a great fitting shoe but quality has decreased.
customer_reviews.text: only 16 months of wear and these boots are already falling apart. pretty disappointing. will look for some boot glue and fix them. It's really to bad because the boots are the best fitting I have ever found.
customer_reviews.author: John Hosford

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Perfect boot for hiking right out of the box, no breaking in needed and very comfortable. These boots look and feel like they were built pretty rugged.
customer_reviews.author: HypoxicDrive98103

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I wear 11.5 in many different keen shoes, these were way too small, felt like a 9.5 , sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: Billy L. Littlejr

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the boots. There is some breaking it that needs to be done but overall they fit very well and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lannes J. Hilboldt

customer_reviews.title: Keen Rocks
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Keen boots, these are somewhat different from my others, but almost the same. The fit was perfect, the look awesome as expected... only change I made.. was to get a pair of Dr Scholls inserts, and wow!
customer_reviews.author: H. Allen.

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA!!!!!!!!!!! A must for me!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would have rated it zero stars if possible!!!!! Was told they were assembled in the USA with world sourced material! Negative in that! Made in some Asian country! Didn’t even put them on my feet! Going back to the hole they came from ASAP!!!! Liars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bentz D. Huschke

customer_reviews.title: First hiking boot, love me some Keen!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I went to a retail place to try on a couple different styles of these, to get what my size would be. Then found these $40 cheaper than the retail places had them, on Amazon! Instantly owned then, and have used them a few times. My first real hiking boot, and I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: The Brandonator

customer_reviews.title: Toe box a bit large
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 12 and the length was a good fit however the toe box had a little too much room for my foot. Other than the toe box being a little large... it seemed to be a comfortable shoe and well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Very good boot!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my son. He is very happy with them. Great fit, very comfortable and very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Good look - great fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband as a delayed Christmas present. He LOVES them!! Great fit and comfortable from the moment he put them on. He likes to "play" in the snow (mostly shoveling) and these waterproof boots are ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzieo

customer_reviews.title: These shoes fit nicely. Enough room for heavy socks and lite weight ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit nicely. Enough room for heavy socks and lite weight on my feet. I believe I will walk quite a distance in them and feel fine 😉
customer_reviews.author: DES

customer_reviews.title: Keen by far is the best shoe I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Keen by far is the best shoe I have ever purchased! You get what you pay for! Love this shoe...goes on like a slipper, I can wear it all day with no issues. Super support, and quality that surpasses all I have worn or seen. Keen Rocks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul S Fuller

customer_reviews.title: and these are nice boots. There's extra room for wearing heavy socks
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of Keens, and these are nice boots. There's extra room for wearing heavy socks, and the tread is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Graham

customer_reviews.title: Classic Keen
customer_reviews.text: Classic Keen fit. Very comfortable and seems to be well built.
customer_reviews.author: D. Platt

customer_reviews.title: Check the size
customer_reviews.text: Until now it's working well on my raugh hiking trails
customer_reviews.author: Mateus

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Fit well and have held up well over the years
customer_reviews.author: MarinersFan

customer_reviews.title: great hikers
customer_reviews.text: great shoes! Sent to our son in Alaska and they fit him great first time. Keen makes a great hiker.
customer_reviews.author: svfarb

customer_reviews.title: Nice but Narrow
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots but too narrow in toebox and sides too tight with hiking socks on so no room for swelling after long miles of hiking.
customer_reviews.author: christine biswabic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and comfortable, no need to break them in. I took them out of the box and went on a long Michigan hike no sore feet. I believe they will hold just fine. I will update if things change
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Masiarczyk

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and fit as expected. They are very light also! I’ve only wore them about 20 days in very wet conditions and they still look new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These fit very nicely and are extremely comfortable even on longer hikes with the family. I have not had an issue with the waterproof feature yet.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Geiger

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love! My feet used to hurt after half day ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love! My feet used to hurt after half day of hiking but these fixed that problem. They also provide the perfect amount of ankle support!
customer_reviews.author: Brisha B

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Great quality as usual from Keen. I wear these in the rain and snow and they help keep my feet dry. Also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua T.

customer_reviews.title: Quality boots
customer_reviews.text: I loved my steel toe keens so much that I decided to buy these for hiking. Very comfortable, very lightweight. I’ve hiked 50 miles in them this summer and they’ve held up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Zac1278

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but could be more durable
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe, it didn’t seem to last as long as I’d like. Though I am hard on my shoes. I would buy another pair of keens and see If they last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Big daddy

customer_reviews.title: Built to Lsst
customer_reviews.text: These are my third pair of this boot. I have the 2d pair as a spare. The 1st set lasted me 3 years with very hard outdoor use in tropical climate. Great fit. Indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: Footprint Possibilities Inc

customer_reviews.title: Actually pretty waterproof
customer_reviews.text: 17-20K steps a day on concrete, asphalt, grass, and carpet. They still feel comfortable after 10 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Womack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boot. Fits comfortably with almost no break in ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot. Fits comfortably with almost no break in period. It's lightweight, water repellent, and looks good too. Keen is my go to shoe for everyday wear and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Alden

customer_reviews.title: Well made . Fit is perfect .
customer_reviews.text: Fits as defined . Well made with plenty of support . I bought these to wear on motorcycle runs to destinations that offer walking and short hiking site seeing . They work very well for me .
customer_reviews.author: missinglink

customer_reviews.title: I won't buy or wear anything else
customer_reviews.text: Since I started wearing Keens, I won't buy or wear anything else. Always fit and feel great as well as long lasting. Love the waterproof feature and the shoelace clips. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Best boot I've worn in 45 years!
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a more comfortable boot! Best fit of any brand I've worn in 45 years. (I order hiking boots 1/2 size larger than my dress shoe size, and this was no exception.) KEEN is the only sandal, shoe or boot I buy. They are the most comfortable footwear that exists.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Randolph

customer_reviews.title: good boots,  see to run short (small)
customer_reviews.text: I like the boots and I'm generally fond of keen products but these are a bit short for me. I pretty much always wear 10 1/2 and these were too short.
customer_reviews.author: TX gadget nutTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: These are beautiful! And comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful! And comfortable! I have 6 pair of Keens, a variety of styles, now that I’m retired I’m not sure I’ll buy another brand. Live in Idaho, travel a lot. They are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, good comfort
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, good comfort, nice lg toe box. Sole delaminated in 3 months, I'm 65 and put about 5000 steps a day around the house and yard. I wouldn't call it a hiker, unless your hike is only to the mail box and your ok with a barefoot return trip. I will see if Keen will make it right.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: I wish they were wider like advertised...
customer_reviews.text: Great boots light weight. I ordered them for work boots and I am pretty satisfied. I read all the reviews and most implied that they are wider than true to size. If I would have know they were not, I would have gotten a larger size. If your a 10.5 go up a size.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's Gypsum Ii Mid Wp High Rise Hiking Shoes
product_meta.description: Waterproof, nubuck and mesh upper keen.Dry® waterproof, breathable membrane breathable mesh lining eva strobel for cushioning dual-density, compression-molded eva midsole ESS shank offers lightweight support heel support structure for stability non-marking rubber outsole leaves no trace 4mm multi-directional lugs for traction clean sport next™ for natural odor control
feature_bullets: Lace-up hiking boot featuring waterproof nubuck/mesh upper with pull loop at tongue and padded collar
